email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out with a freight offer for a crude oil shipment from Rotterdam to Singapore. We have a vessel available, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and LOA of 280m. The laycan is October 15-20. Starting freight rate is $50.75 per ton. Let me know your thoughts. Best regards, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the offer. The laycan works for us, but the freight rate is a bit high. Would you consider $49.50 per ton? Also, could you confirm the vessel’s specifications and any demurrage terms? Best, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your response. I can bring the rate down to $50.00 per ton, which is quite competitive given the current market. The MV Ocean Star is in excellent condition, and demurrage is set at $25,000 per day, pro-rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the update. $50.00 per ton is acceptable, but could we cap the demurrage at $20,000 per day? Also, can you confirm the laycan is still October 15-20? Best, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I can agree to cap the demurrage at $20,000 per day. The laycan remains October 15-20. If this works for you, I’ll draft the charter party agreement. Let me know. Best, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, that sounds good. Please proceed with drafting the charter party agreement. Looking forward to finalizing this. Best, John.
